item.description:
Our discussion for April and May will focus on the book by Henepola Gunaratana, "Eight Mindful Steps to Happiness: Walking the Buddha's Path." In the Eightfold Path, the Buddha offered a complete guide for living happily: skillfulness in understanding, thinking, speech, action, livelihood, effort, mindfulness, and concentration. This book explains in clear language, with quotes from the sutras, and illustrations from real life -- how to use these steps to turn every situation that arises into an opportunity for peace and joy. This book (like Gunaratana's excellent "Mindfulness in Plain English") is an accessible teaching for beginners and an excellent review for the experienced Buddhist practitioner. Gunaratana is the Buddhist chaplain at American University in Washington, DC. This book was published in 2001 by Wisdom Publications and is available in paperback.

When reading this book you are encouged to think of examples from your own life that show where the teachings of the "Eightfold Path" meet the reality of everyday life.
